sentence: Wall Street limped into the close on Friday but still ended the week on a high note as a sell-off in oil compounded by pressure on component stock Apple ( AAPL ) and hawkish comments from Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren left the Dow Jones Industrial Average with a triple-digit loss and its first negative close in four days.

Nine of the ten S&P 500 sectors were in the red with energy taking the brunt of today's selling pressure followed by losses in the technology sector, while 27 of the Dow's 30 component stocks were negative.
Weakness in oil futures threw cold water on Wall Street's three-day winning streak that was triggered by Wednesday's decision by the Federal Open Market Committee not to raise U.S. interest rates.
West Texas Intermediate crude oil was as much as 3.5% lower as the likelihood for production cuts at next week's OPEC meeting in Algiers dissolved amid bickering between Saudi Arabia and Iran.
Apple shares, meanwhile, took a hit after a German research firm said iPhone 7 sales were down 25% from comparable sales of the iPhone 6 last year.
Facebook ( FB ) was also pressuring the Nasdaq when its shares fell sharply after the company admitted it overestimated the time users spend viewing videos in its site.
Twitter ( TWTR ), however, rallied more than 21% when rumors swirled that Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and Salesforce ( CRM ) were interested in buying the social media company.

On the economic/Fed front, a leading manufacturing index dipped to a 3-month low, and Rosengren defended his dissent at Wednesday's FOMC meeting by saying that the risk of leaving interest rates too low for too long could undermine the economic recovery.
Rosengren said that the case for raising U.S. rates "was even more compelling."
As a result, the Nasdaq backed off its record high from Thursday, but closed the week 1.2% higher.
The Dow gained 0.8% from last Friday, and the S&P 500 was up 1.2%.

Here's where the markets stood at the close:

(+) BLRX (+26.73%) Signed an exclusive agreement with BGN Technologies for in-licensing of liver failure treatment

(+) IMPV (+21.13%) Rumors that IBM (IMB) or Cisco ( CSCO ) might be interested in an acquisition

(-) ENPH (-28.14%) Announced restructuring and cost reduction measures including job cuts and elimination of non-core projects, expected to result in annualized savings of $20 million
